subject: Learning
title: Digital Natives: Born Tech-Savvy?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Digital Natives: Born Tech-Savvy?.

hook.text: Kids today grew up with iPads. Surely they're natural digital learners. They're not.

buildup.text: Marc Prensky coined 'digital natives' in 2001, claiming young people learn differently with tech.

discovery.text: Research shows young people are no better at evaluating online sources or learning from tech than adults.

twist.text: Familiarity with social media doesn't equal digital literacy. Swiping is not the same as evaluating.

climax.text: Students need explicit instruction in digital skills just like any otherâ€”there's no innate advantage.

punchline.text: Growing up with technology isn't the same as understanding it.

quiz.question: What does research say about digital natives?
options: Young people need explicit digital literacy instruction like everyone else
They naturally evaluate online sources better
All children are expert coders by age 10
